text: Great odds, but the app is slow.
notes: Positive (odds) + Negative (app). Net=NEGATIVE because app issue is brand-controlled.

text: Thanks for the free bet, shame United are useless.
notes: Compliment on promo but complaint is about team performance. Not actionable.
Vague but context implies brand criticism. No sport context = brand issue.

text: I am the worst gambler in history.
Funny how the server only goes down when I'm winning.
notes: Sarcastic implication that brand sabotages winners. Service complaint.

text: Decent app but customer service is non-existent.
notes: Positive (app) + Negative (CS). Net=NEGATIVE because CS is brand-controlled.

text: Love the new interface! Still waiting 5 days for my withdrawal though.
notes: Praise for UI but complaint about withdrawal delay. Net=NEGATIVE.

text: My horse lost but at least the cashout was instant.
notes: Sport loss (not brand) + Brand compliment (cashout). Focus on brand praise.

text: Rigged odds. Every time I bet big, I lose.
notes: Accusing brand of rigging. Scam accusation even if irrational.

text: William Hill didn't make Arsenal miss that penalty lol
notes: User correctly attributes loss to sport, not brand. Not actionable.

text: App crashed mid-bet and I missed the winner. Fuming.
notes: App crash (brand issue) caused user to miss bet. Brand-controlled.

text: Worst bookie ever. My team never wins.
notes: 'Worst bookie' sounds brand-related but reason given is team performance.

text: Verification took 2 weeks but support was helpful.
notes: 2-week delay is material compliance/churn risk. Polite support does not negate service failure.

text: Just lost my entire bankroll. Thanks William Hill ðŸ™„
notes: Sarcasm but user lost due to gambling, not brand issue. Self-inflicted.

text: The odds were great, the app was smooth, and I still lost. Classic me.
notes: All brand aspects positive. Loss is user's gambling outcome.
